section.title: Introduction
section.p: Forrest provides a robust technological infrastructure for open software development for the Apache Software Foundation based on ASF software, ASF practices and experience, and modern software design principles.

Our first target is to create a consistent xml.apache.org website, with a uniform, lightweight, easy-to-navigate layout and structure. Each project will be responsible for maintaining its own documentation and website, which are imported, aggregated and published automatically by Forrest. The framework is intentionally designed to allow Forrest to also be applied in other projects.

The Forrest framework comprises XML document grammars for the different types of documents that a project website typically consists of, a skinning facility to easily apply a different user interface, local and robot-based build systems to draw XML content from a repository and publish to local or remote sites, and a Cocoon-based site generation mechanism.

section.title: Project Status
section.p: The Forrest project is new and needs your help to get started.

ul.li: Read our Forrest Primer to understand what Forrest is and how you can use / contribute to it.
Please see the FAQ and join the discussion on forrest-dev@xml.apache.org.
There is also a fledgling Dream List to help provide some direction.
The Forrest website is updated irregularly and manually, while we develop the forrestbot facility.
